action: I want to export sales reports by period and by person-in-charge
reason: To understand accurate numerical data for management decisions and progress management
acceptance_criteria: Report output is only executable by authenticated users.
Only roles with report viewing permissions can export reports.
Output target period (Start Date and End Date) is mandatory input.
An error occurs if the Start Date is after the End Date.
Date formats are unified in ISO format.
Filtering by person-in-charge must be possible.
Filtering by department must be possible.
Total sales must be automatically calculated.
Toggle display between tax-inclusive and tax-exclusive must be possible.
Currency units follow system settings.
Numerical values are rounded according to decimal point processing rules.
SQL injection countermeasures are applied during data retrieval.
Aggregation processing guarantees DB transaction consistency.
Reports can be exported in CSV format.
Reports can be exported in PDF format.
CSV output is generated with UTF-8 character encoding.
No layout corruption occurs during PDF output.
Output processing can be executed asynchronously.
Background jobs handle large data volume exports.
Notifications are sent upon completion of output.
Output history must be stored.
Output history includes user_id, conditions, and timestamp.
Users without permissions cannot view data from other departments.
Masking settings for personal information must be available.
HTTPS communication is mandatory.
API responses do not include internal error details.
Timeout control is implemented for the report generation process.
Logs are stored if report generation fails.
Logs are stored as audit targets.
Rate limiting is applied to the report API.
API must be REST-compliant.
API versioning management is implemented.
History management is implemented for changes in aggregation logic.
Result hashes can be generated to prevent numerical tampering.
Report display screens are controlled by role-based UI.
Target response time is within 1 second.
A batch regeneration function must exist.
Alerts occur upon detection of data inconsistency.
Report templates can be edited from the management screen.
Operation audit logs are stored in tamper-evident storage.
